Problem:
Consider a system governed by a complex function \\( z(t) = e^{iAt}z_0 \\), where A is a real constant and \\( z_0 \\) is the initial complex value. The function is modified by an integral transformation \\( G(z) = \\int_0^T e^{iBt}z(t) dt \\), with B as another real constant.

If \\( G(z) \\) is applied to \\( z_0 \\) at the start and the result is allowed to evolve according to \\( z(t) = e^{iAt}z_0 \\) without further intervention, will the final state \\( z(T) \\) be the same as if \\( z_0 \\) was directly evolved to time T under \\( z(t) = e^{iAt}z_0 \\)?
Explanation: The transformation \\( G(z) \\) integrates the effect of \\( e^{iBt}z(t) \\) over time, effectively changing the trajectory from its original. Since the transformation introduces integration over a path influenced by B, the evolution of \\( z(t) \\) from this new initial state will not coincide with the unaltered evolution of \\( z_0 \\) under \\( e^{iAt} \\).
